class.name: Signal
class.brief_description: Class representing a signal defined in an object.

constructor.name: Signal
constructor.description: Constructs a null [Signal] with no object nor signal name bound.

constructor.name: Signal
constructor.description: Constructs a [Signal] as a copy of the given [Signal].

constructor.name: Signal
constructor.description: Creates a new [Signal] with the name [code]signal[/code] in the specified [code]object[/code].

method.name: connect
method.description:
Connects this signal to the specified [Callable], optionally providing connection flags. You can provide additional arguments to the connected method call by using [method Callable.bind]. [codeblock] for button in $Buttons.get_children(): button.pressed.connect(on_pressed.bind(button))
func on_pressed(button): print(button.name, " was pressed") [/codeblock]

method.name: disconnect
method.description: Disconnects this signal from the specified [Callable].

method.name: emit
method.description: Emits this signal to all connected objects.

method.name: get_connections
method.description: Returns the list of [Callable]s connected to this signal.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Returns the name of this signal.

method.name: get_object
method.description: Returns the object emitting this signal.

method.name: get_object_id
method.description: Returns the ID of the object emitting this signal (see [method Object.get_instance_id]).

method.name: is_connected
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified [Callable] is connected to this signal.
